api_token.description: API Token granting privileges to Okta API.

backoff.description: Use exponential back off strategy for rate limits.

base_url.description: The Okta url. (Use 'oktapreview.com' for Okta testing)

max_retries.description: maximum number of retries to attempt before erroring out.

max_wait_seconds.description: maximum seconds to wait when rate limit is hit. We use exponential backoffs when backoff is enabled.

min_wait_seconds.description: minimum seconds to wait when rate limit is hit. We use exponential backoffs when backoff is enabled.

org_name.description: The organization to manage in Okta.

parallelism.description: Number of concurrent requests to make within a resource where bulk operations are not possible. Take note of https://developer.okta.com/docs/api/getting_started/rate-limits.

hide_ios.description: Do not display application icon on mobile app

hide_web.description: Do not display application icon to users

shared_password.description: Shared password, required for certain schemes.

shared_username.description: Shared username, required for certain schemes.

hide_ios.description: Do not display application icon on mobile app

hide_web.description: Do not display application icon to users

hide_ios.description: Do not display application icon on mobile app

hide_web.description: Do not display application icon to users

client_basic_secret.description: OAuth client secret key, this can be set when token_endpoint_auth_method is client_secret_basic.

client_id.description: OAuth client ID. If set during creation, app is created with this id.

client_secret.description: OAuth client secret key. This will be in plain text in your statefile unless you set omit_secret above.

client_uri.description: URI to a web page providing information about the client.

consent_method.description: *Early Access Property*. Indicates whether user consent is required or implicit. Valid values: REQUIRED, TRUSTED. Default value is TRUSTED

custom_client_id.description: **Deprecated** This property allows you to set your client_id during creation. NOTE: updating after creation will be a no-op, use client_id for that behavior instead.

grant_types.description: List of OAuth 2.0 grant types. Conditional validation params found here https://developer.okta.com/docs/api/resources/apps#credentials-settings-details. Defaults to minimum requirements per app type.

hide_ios.description: Do not display application icon on mobile app

hide_web.description: Do not display application icon to users

issuer_mode.description: *Early Access Property*. Indicates whether the Okta Authorization Server uses the original Okta org domain URL or a custom domain URL as the issuer of ID token for this client.

logo_uri.description: URI that references a logo for the client.

omit_secret.description: This tells the provider not to persist the application's secret to state. If this is ever changes from true => false your app will be recreated.

policy_uri.description: *Early Access Property*. URI to web page providing client policy document.

post_logout_redirect_uris.description: List of URIs for redirection after logout

profile.description: Custom JSON that represents an OAuth application's profile

redirect_uris.description: List of URIs for use in the redirect-based flow. This is required for all application types except service. Note: see okta_app_oauth_redirect_uri for appending to this list in a decentralized way.

response_types.description: List of OAuth 2.0 response type strings.

token_endpoint_auth_method.description: Requested authentication method for the token endpoint.

tos_uri.description: *Early Access Property*. URI to web page providing client tos (terms of service).

uri.description: Redirect URI to append to Okta OIDC application.

assertion_signed.description: Determines whether the SAML assertion is digitally signed

authn_context_class_ref.description: Identifies the SAML authentication context class for the assertionâ€™s authentication statement

certificate.description: cert from SAML XML metadata payload

default_relay_state.description: Identifies a specific application resource in an IDP initiated SSO scenario.

destination.description: Identifies the location where the SAML response is intended to be sent inside of the SAML assertion

digest_algorithm.description: Determines the digest algorithm used to digitally sign the SAML assertion and response

entity_key.description: Entity ID, the ID portion of the entity_url

hide_ios.description: Do not display application icon on mobile app

hide_web.description: Do not display application icon to users

honor_force_authn.description: Prompt user to re-authenticate if SP asks for it

key_name.description: Certificate name. This modulates the rotation of keys. New name == new key.

key_years_valid.description: Number of years the certificate is valid.

preconfigured_app.description: Name of preexisting SAML application. For instance 'slack'

recipient.description: The location where the app may present the SAML assertion

request_compressed.description: Denotes whether the request is compressed or not.

response_signed.description: Determines whether the SAML auth response message is digitally signed

signature_algorithm.description: Signature algorithm used ot digitally sign the assertion and response

subject_name_id_template.description: Template for app user's username when a user is assigned to the app

hide_ios.description: Do not display application icon on mobile app

hide_web.description: Do not display application icon to users

optional_field1.description: Name of optional param in the login form

optional_field1_value.description: Name of optional value in login form

optional_field2.description: Name of optional param in the login form

optional_field2_value.description: Name of optional value in login form

optional_field3.description: Name of optional param in the login form

optional_field3_value.description: Name of optional value in login form

shared_username.description: Shared username, required for certain schemes.

hide_ios.description: Do not display application icon on mobile app

hide_web.description: Do not display application icon to users

url_regex.description: A regex that further restricts URL to the specified regex

hide_web.description: Do not display application icon to users

url_regex.description: A regex that further restricts URL to the specified regex

master.description: SubSchema profile manager, if not set it will inherit its setting.

permissions.description: SubSchema permissions: HIDE, READ_ONLY, or READ_WRITE.

type.description: Subschema type: string, boolean, number, integer, array, or object

array_enum.description: Custom Subschema enumerated value of a property of type array.

array_type.description: Subschema array type: string, number, integer, reference. Type field must be an array.

enum.description: Custom Subschema enumerated value of the property. see: developer.okta.com/docs/api/resources/schemas#user-profile-schema-property-object

master.description: SubSchema profile manager, if not set it will inherit its setting.

max_length.description: Subschema of type string maximum length

min_length.description: Subschema of type string minimum length

permissions.description: SubSchema permissions: HIDE, READ_ONLY, or READ_WRITE.

type.description: Subschema type: string, boolean, number, integer, array, or object

block.description: array of valid JSON schemas for property type array.

audiences.description: Currently Okta only supports a single value here

credentials_rotation_mode.description: Credential rotation mode, in many cases you cannot set this to MANUAL, the API will ignore the value and you will get a perpetual diff. This should rarely be used.

issuer.description: EA Feature: allows you to use a custom issuer URL

issuer_mode.description: EA Feature: allows you to use a custom issuer URL

scopes.description: Auth server claim list of scopes

priority.description: Priority of the auth server policy

type.description: Auth server policy type, unlikely this will be anything other then the default

grant_type_whitelist.description: Accepted grant type values: authorization_code, implicit, password.

priority.description: Priority of the auth server policy rule

type.description: Auth server policy rule type, unlikely this will be anything other then the default

consent.description: EA Feature and thus it is simply ignored if the feature is off

default.description: A default scope will be returned in an access token when the client omits the scope parameter in a token request, provided this scope is allowed as part of the access policy rule.

metadata_publish.description: Whether to publish metadata or not, matching API type despite the fact it could just be a boolean

hide_ios.description: Do not display application icon on mobile app

hide_web.description: Do not display application icon to users

shared_password.description: Shared password, required for certain schemes.

shared_username.description: Shared username, required for certain schemes.

hide_web.description: Do not display application icon to users

users.description: Users associated with the group. This can also be done per user.

admin_roles.description: Admin roles associated with the group. This can also be done per user.

group_id.description: ID of group to attach admin roles to

issuer_mode.description: Indicates whether Okta uses the original Okta org domain URL, or a custom domain URL

request_signature_algorithm.description: algorithm to use to sign requests

request_signature_scope.description: algorithm to use to sign response

response_signature_algorithm.description: algorithm to use to sign requests

response_signature_scope.description: algorithm to use to sign response

groups_included.description: List of Group IDs to Include

priority.description: Policy Priority, this attribute can be set to a valid priority. To avoid endless diff situation we error if an invalid priority is provided. API defaults it to the last/lowest if not there.

enroll.description: Should the user be enrolled the first time they LOGIN, the next time they are CHALLENGEd, or NEVER?

network_connection.description: Network selection mode: ANYWHERE, ZONE, ON_NETWORK, or OFF_NETWORK.

priority.description: Policy Rule Priority, this attribute can be set to a valid priority. To avoid endless diff situation we error if an invalid priority is provided. API defaults it to the last/lowest if not there.

status.description: Policy Rule Status: ACTIVE or INACTIVE.

users_excluded.description: Set of User IDs to Exclude

dynamic_locations.description: Array of locations ISO-3166-1(2). Format code: countryCode OR countryCode-regionCode

gateways.description: Array of values in CIDR/range form depending on the way it's been declared (i.e. CIDR will contain /suffix). Please check API docs for examples

name.description: Name of the Network Zone Resource

proxies.description: Array of values in CIDR/range form depending on the way it's been declared (i.e. CIDR will contain /suffix). Please check API docs for examples

type.description: Type of the Network Zone - can either be IP or DYNAMIC only

client_basic_secret.description: OAuth client secret key, this can be set when token_endpoint_auth_method is client_secret_basic.

client_id.description: OAuth client ID. If set during creation, app is created with this id.

client_secret.description: OAuth client secret key. This will be in plain text in your statefile unless you set omit_secret above.

client_uri.description: URI to a web page providing information about the client.

consent_method.description: *Early Access Property*. Indicates whether user consent is required or implicit. Valid values: REQUIRED, TRUSTED. Default value is TRUSTED

custom_client_id.description: **Deprecated** This property allows you to set your client_id during creation. NOTE: updating after creation will be a no-op, use client_id for that behavior instead.

grant_types.description: List of OAuth 2.0 grant types. Conditional validation params found here https://developer.okta.com/docs/api/resources/apps#credentials-settings-details. Defaults to minimum requirements per app type.

hide_web.description: Do not display application icon to users

issuer_mode.description: *Early Access Property*. Indicates whether the Okta Authorization Server uses the original Okta org domain URL or a custom domain URL as the issuer of ID token for this client.

logo_uri.description: URI that references a logo for the client.

omit_secret.description: This tells the provider not to persist the application's secret to state. If this is ever changes from true => false your app will be recreated.

policy_uri.description: *Early Access Property*. URI to web page providing client policy document.

post_logout_redirect_uris.description: List of URIs for redirection after logout

profile.description: Custom JSON that represents an OAuth application's profile

redirect_uris.description: List of URIs for use in the redirect-based flow. This is required for all application types except service. Note: see okta_app_oauth_redirect_uri for appending to this list in a decentralized way.

response_types.description: List of OAuth 2.0 response type strings.

token_endpoint_auth_method.description: Requested authentication method for the token endpoint.

tos_uri.description: *Early Access Property*. URI to web page providing client tos (terms of service).

uri.description: Redirect URI to append to Okta OIDC application.

email_recovery.description: Enable or disable email password recovery: ACTIVE or INACTIVE.

groups_included.description: List of Group IDs to Include

password_auto_unlock_minutes.description: Number of minutes before a locked account is unlocked: 0 = no limit.

password_dictionary_lookup.description: Check Passwords Against Common Password Dictionary.

password_exclude_first_name.description: User firstName attribute must be excluded from the password

password_exclude_last_name.description: User lastName attribute must be excluded from the password

password_exclude_username.description: If the user name must be excluded from the password.

password_expire_warn_days.description: Length in days a user will be warned before password expiry: 0 = no warning.

password_history_count.description: Number of distinct passwords that must be created before they can be reused: 0 = none.

password_lockout_notification_channels.description: Notification channels to use to notify a user when their account has been locked.

password_max_age_days.description: Length in days a password is valid before expiry: 0 = no limit.

password_max_lockout_attempts.description: Number of unsuccessful login attempts allowed before lockout: 0 = no limit.

password_min_age_minutes.description: Minimum time interval in minutes between password changes: 0 = no limit.

password_min_lowercase.description: If a password must contain at least one lower case letter: 0 = no, 1 = yes. Default = 1

password_min_number.description: If a password must contain at least one number: 0 = no, 1 = yes. Default = 1

password_min_symbol.description: If a password must contain at least one symbol (!@#$%^&*): 0 = no, 1 = yes. Default = 1

password_min_uppercase.description: If a password must contain at least one upper case letter: 0 = no, 1 = yes. Default = 1

password_show_lockout_failures.description: If a user should be informed when their account is locked.

priority.description: Policy Priority, this attribute can be set to a valid priority. To avoid endless diff situation we error if an invalid priority is provided. API defaults it to the last/lowest if not there.

question_min_length.description: Min length of the password recovery question answer.

question_recovery.description: Enable or disable security question password recovery: ACTIVE or INACTIVE.

recovery_email_token.description: Lifetime in minutes of the recovery email token.

skip_unlock.description: When an Active Directory user is locked out of Okta, the Okta unlock operation should also attempt to unlock the user's Windows account.

sms_recovery.description: Enable or disable SMS password recovery: ACTIVE or INACTIVE.

network_connection.description: Network selection mode: ANYWHERE, ZONE, ON_NETWORK, or OFF_NETWORK.

password_change.description: Allow or deny a user to change their password: ALLOW or DENY. Default = ALLOW

password_reset.description: Allow or deny a user to reset their password: ALLOW or DENY. Default = ALLOW

password_unlock.description: Allow or deny a user to unlock. Default = DENY

priority.description: Policy Rule Priority, this attribute can be set to a valid priority. To avoid endless diff situation we error if an invalid priority is provided. API defaults it to the last/lowest if not there.

status.description: Policy Rule Status: ACTIVE or INACTIVE.

users_excluded.description: Set of User IDs to Exclude

groups_included.description: List of Group IDs to Include

type.description: Policy type: OKTA_SIGN_ON, PASSWORD, MFA_ENROLL, IDP_DISCOVERY, or OAUTH_AUTHORIZATION_POLICY

user_id.description: Retrieve a single user based on their id

name.description: Property name to search for. This requires the search feature be on. Please see Okta documentation on their filter API for users. https://developer.okta.com/docs/api/resources/users#list-users-with-search

block.description: Filter to find a user, each filter will be concatenated with an AND clause. Please be aware profile properties must match what is in Okta, which is likely camel case
